body.p:
Perform the following steps to reconfigure the Ceph services.
Login to the lifecycle manager
Configure the following parameters in the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file.
osd_settle_time
osd_journal_size
data_disk_poll_interval
data_disk_poll_attempts
Any additional configuration parameters for Ceph (beyond those listed in the ~/helion/my_cloud/config/ceph/settings.yml file) can be specified in the same file under the extra: category:extra: osd: journal max write entries: 200
As shown above, configures the OSDs to write a maximum of 200 entries (journal max write entries: 200) to the journal at any one time. The Ceph log parameter debug auth configures the verbosity of the authentication related logs, which by default is configured to a level of 1/5. Having debug auth logging verbosely is a security risk as the module will start logging the Ceph user secrets. These secrets will be available to users via the centralized logs, making the Ceph cluster vulnerable. Therefore, it is highly recommended not to have the debug auth logging verbosely.
Commit the changes to git:git add -A git commit -m "changing Ceph configuration"
Update your deployment directory:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the playbook to reconfigure the Ceph services:$cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-reconfigure.yml
